meanings.definition: Having both hydrophilic and hydrophobic properties.
meanings.sent1: The soap was amphiphilic, able to dissolve in both water and oil.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the behavior of amphiphilic molecules in different solvents.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous bubble was so amphiphilic that it played with both water and oil.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like an amphiphilic molecule, balancing between two contrasting traits.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of an amphiphilic substance interacting with water and oil.

meanings.definition: A molecule with both water-attracting and water-repelling components.
meanings.sent1: The detergent contained an amphiphilic that helped clean dishes effectively.
meanings.sent2: Researchers discovered a new type of amphiphilic in the marine environment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous drop of water avoided the amphiphilic molecule in the experiment.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemistry, an amphiphilic is like a magnet with both attraction and repulsion.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to demonstrate how an amphiphilic molecule interacts with water and oil.
